items.title: Ahead of IPO, LG India banks on domestic demand, premium portfolio and export hub ambition
items.summary: The IPO, scheduled for 7-9 October, will see the South Korean parent firm sell about 15% of its stake in its Indian arm. Since no new equity will be issued, the subsidiary will not receive any funds from the offering.

items.title: India central bank allows banks to fund acquisitions, lend more for IPOs
items.summary: INDIA-CENBANK-BANKS:India central bank allows banks to fund acquisitions, lend more for IPOs

items.title: 'Contaminated' cough syrup linked deaths: NCDS collects water, entomological drug samples
items.summary: NCDC collected water and entomological drug samples from Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan after multiple children died of kidney failure, allegedly linked to contaminated cough syrup. These samples will be tested for infectious diseases, while state drug authorities await results from drug sample tests. Six children died in MP and one in Rajasthan, prompting a ban on 19 syrup batches.

items.title: Cloud-powered feature phones could unlock 40% revenue growth for Indian telcos
items.summary: CloudMosa projects India's 350 million feature phone users can significantly boost telecom revenues. Their cloud-powered 4G devices, enabling smartphone features on affordable handsets, are expected to increase ARPU by 40% and reduce churn by 30%. This model, proven in Vietnam, offers scalable, affordable connectivity for India's 2G users.

items.title: Cabinet approves 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas with an outlay of more than Rs 5,862 cr
items.summary: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs approved 57 new Kendriya Vidyalayas. These schools will cater to central government employees' children. The project involves Rs 5,862.55 crore over nine years from 2026-27. This includes capital and operational expenditures. For the first time, these KVs will feature Balvatikas. Twenty KVs will open in districts lacking existing schools.

items.title: US-based Sonos bets on India as premium audio demand rises despite global slowdown
items.summary: Sonos is intensifying its focus on India, identifying it as a rapidly growing market in Asia-Pacific despite a global revenue decline. The company is expanding its presence and localizing offerings, noting strong demand for premium, integrated audio systems among Indian consumers. Sonos aims to leverage its core strengths amidst competition in the evolving home audio segment.

items.title: Cash-Rich & Growing: 9 Midcap stocks with rising operating cash flow
items.summary: Ten NSE midcap companies, including Waaree Energies, Biocon, Sona BLW, UNO Minda, and Torrent Power, consistently grew operating cash flow over five years, signaling stronger profitability, efficient operations, and reduced reliance on external funding.

items.title: Top Gainers & Losers on Oct 01: Netweb Tech, Tata Motors, Adani Power, Vodafone Idea, Trent among top gainers
items.summary: The Indian stock market rebounded on October 1, with key indexes gaining nearly 1%. The rally, driven by banking stocks, followed RBI's measures to boost liquidity while maintaining the repo rate at 5.5%. Nifty Media surged 3.79%, while Nifty PSU Bank lagged with a 0.30% drop.

items.title: RBI announces host of measures to improve flow of Bank credit
items.summary: The aforementioned measures are being considered in a bid to rationalise the extant guidelines and broaden the scope for capital market lending by banks and other regulated entities

items.title: Stock market today: 118 stocks hit 52-week lows, 150 stocks at 52-week high as Nifty 50, Sensex end nearly 1% higher
items.summary: Stock market today: 118 stocks hit 52-week lows, 150 stocks at 52-week high as Nifty 50, Sensex end nearly 1% higher

items.title: GST 2.0, festive demand drive double-digit sales growth at M&M, Toyota in September
items.summary: Hyundai reports marginal growth, but records highest-ever monthly sales of Creta at 18,861 units

items.title: Sensex snaps 8-day losing streak, investors earn  ₹4 lakh crore in a day— 10 key highlights from Indian stock market
items.summary: Stock market today: The Sensex ended the day 716 points, or 0.89 per cent, higher at 80,983.31, while the Nifty 50 settled at 24,836.30, up 225 points, or 0.92 per cent.

items.title: This small-cap, agri stock jumps 80% YTD; do you own?
items.summary: GRM Overseas has experienced an impressive 80% rise in stock value this year, driven by strategic investments and a booming rice-export market. With major investors increasing their stakes and promising financial results, the company is well-positioned for future growth in the agri sector.

items.title: New online gaming law takes effect, money games banned from today
items.summary: India's new Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Act, 2025, has banned online money games nationwide, effective Wednesday. This move aims to curb social and financial risks, including money laundering and terror financing. The industry is now pivoting towards eSports and social gaming, with the government envisioning India as a global game development hub.

items.title: RBI drops proposed restriction on bank-NBFC overlap
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India scrapped plans to bar banks from overlapping business lines with their NBFC subsidiaries, offering a boost to private lenders. HDFC, ICICI, and Axis Bank shares rose as the move preserves flexibility for growth and customer targeting.

items.title: Trualt Bioenergy IPO listing date in focus: Here’s what GMP signals about debut of shares
items.summary: Trualt Bioenergy IPO listing date is 3 October 2025, and the stock will be listed on both the stock exchanges. Ahead of the share debut, Trualt Bioenergy IPO GMP today signals strong debut of shares in the stock market.

items.title: DGCA issues rankings of flying training organisations; no FTO gets top rating
items.summary: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, released its inaugural ranking of 35 flying training organisations, with none achieving the top 'A+' or 'A' ratings. Thirteen FTOs received 'B' grades, while 22 were placed in the 'C' category, prompting notices for self-analysis and improvement. These rankings will be published biannually to enhance training standards.

items.title: Gold rate today: How US government shut down likely to affect bullion? Experts weigh in
items.summary: Rahul Kalantri VP commodities at Mehta Equities Ltd, said that gold is often considered a safe-haven asset during political, economic, or financial stress, investors tend to shift capital into gold, which doesn’t carry credit risk in the same way that bonds or equities do.

items.title: RBI holds rates, signals policy space; fixed income managers see scope for December rate cut
items.summary: RBI’s Monetary Policy Committee kept repo rate unchanged at 5.5% with a dovish stance, lowering inflation forecasts, upgrading growth outlook, and unveiling 22 reforms. Experts expect a rate cut by December 2025, boosting bond market sentiment.

items.title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
items.summary: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

items.title: One year of ‘one Air India Express’: From branding to route mix changes, the airline tackles a plethora of challenges
items.summary: The merged entity, which is now over four times its size at the time of privatisation, has grown through every possible means — merger, induction of new aircraft, and transfer of planes from the parent Air India. However, Air India Express faces numerous challenges ahead.

items.title: Augmont Enterprises files DRHP with Sebi to raise Rs 800 crore via IPO
items.summary: Augmont Enterprises, an integrated gold and silver platform, has filed its DRHP with Sebi for an Rs 800 crore IPO, comprising Rs 620 crore fresh issue and Rs 180 crore OFS by promoters.

items.title: Cabinet approves Rs 11,000 cr six-year plan to boost pulses production, raises MSPs for Rabi crops
items.summary: The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday, approved a six-year, Rs 11,000 crore plan to boost domestic pulse production. The initiative aims to increase output, reduce import dependence, and strengthen food security. In a related move, the Cabinet also approved a proposal to raise the Minimum Support Price (MSP) for Rabi crops.

items.title: US government shutdown 2025: What it means for US and Indian stock market?
items.summary: As the US government enters its latest shutdown, experts assess its impact on the stock markets. While some fluctuations are expected, analysts believe the long-term effects will be minimal, with potential benefits for emerging markets like India amidst a weaker US dollar.

items.title: Pause gives banks breathing space, rate cut likely in December: SBI MD
items.summary: SBI MD Vinay Tonse welcomed the RBI's policy pause, offering banks breathing space after rate transmission. He anticipates a potential rate cut in December, with the terminal repo rate settling at 5.25%. Tonse also noted early busy season demand and expressed optimism for sustained credit growth and margin stability, benefiting SBI.

items.title: Trump’s drug tariff has spared most of China’s drugmakers for now but there may be worse to come
items.summary: Chinese drugmakers have been generic drug sellers but have lately begun reshaping global medicine with breakthrough therapies and lucrative deals. Could Trump’s trade policy, under which patented or branded drug imports face a 100% tariff, be aimed at stalling the rise of Chinese pharma rivals?

items.title: ATF price hiked 3%, commercial LPG up  ₹15.50
items.summary: ATF prices were hiked by over 3% or by  ₹3,053 and commercial LPG rates by  ₹15.50 per cylinder on October 1, as OMCs revised fuel prices in line with global benchmarks. Check how much fuel costs in Delhi from today.&nbsp;

items.title: Tata Sons missing IPO deadline: RBI says an entity can continue to do biz till registration isnt cancelled
items.summary: Tata Sons missing IPO deadline: RBI says an entity can continue to do biz till registration isn't cancelled

items.title: DA hike for govt employees: Cabinet okays 3% Dearness Allowance rate increase ahead of Diwali
items.summary: DA Hike: The Union Cabinet approved a 3% Dearness Allowance hike, raising it to 58% for central government employees and pensioners. This significant move, aimed at combating inflation, will benefit millions and is expected to be effective from July 1, 2025, with arrears. It follows a previous 2% increase earlier in March.

items.title: Despite missing listing deadline, Tata Sons to continue doing business: RBI Guv
items.summary: “We don’t comment on any specific entities. Any entity which has a registration, till it is not cancelled, will continue to do its business,” says RBI Governor Malhotra

items.title: RBI to remove ₹10,000 crore ceiling for bank loans to corporates
items.summary: Currently, each corporate entity is allowed to take up to ₹10,000 crore of loan from the entire Indian banking sector and if lenders surpass the ceiling, they have to make heavy provisions

items.title: Tata Motors shares rally 5% as demerger takes effect; record date announced
items.summary: Tata Motors shares rose sharply after the company’s demerger took effect from October 1, with October 14 set as the record date for shareholders. The restructuring, involving TML Commercial Vehicles and passenger vehicles, aims at a sharper business focus and unlocking long-term value.

items.title: RBI to issue draft ECL norms for banks soon
items.summary: The draft directions propose to replace the current framework based on incurred loss with an Expected Credit Loss (ECL) approach, subject to a prudential floor, while retaining the existing asset classification norms

items.title: Loan sanctions grow 86% to Rs 33,148 cr in H1; disbursement up 54%: IREDA
items.summary: State-owned IREDA sanctioned Rs 33,148 crore in loans during April-September FY26. This marks an 86 percent increase from the previous year. Loan disbursements also grew by 54 percent to Rs 15,043 crore. The outstanding loan book reached Rs 84,445 crore by September 30, 2025. CMD Pradip Kumar Das stated IREDA will continue supporting clean energy projects.

items.title: Nikhil Kamath hiring engineers to work directly with him on ‘High stakes. Real impact’ project — Check if you fit
items.summary: Nikhil Kamath is hiring engineers to work directly with him on a ‘High stakes. Real impact’ project for WTF podcast. In a detailed post on X, he wrote about what the ideal candidates would be — Interested? Check if you are a fit.

items.title: Stock market holiday: Is Indian stock market closed tomorrow for Dussehra, Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti?
items.summary: Stock market holiday: Investors are advised to look at the stock market holidays 2025 list on the official BSE website — bseindia.com. Investors can click on the Trading Holidays toolbar at the top of the website to find out the list of stock market holidays in 2025.

items.title: Manufacturing PMI dips in September, while exports rise. Are both blips?
items.summary: The drop in the headline index may be a one-off as manufacturers are confident that GST cuts will boost domestic demand. And while demand from other countries may be offsetting a drop in demand from the US, it's too early to celebrate the increase in exports.

items.title: India Set to Open $40 Billion M&A Market to Local Bank Funding
items.summary: India’s central bank plans to permit local lenders to finance mergers and acquisitions, a move expected to boost the country’s $40 billion-plus deals market.

items.title: GST collection for September rises 9.1% to Rs 1.89 lakh crore
items.summary: India's GST collections surged to Rs 1.89 lakh crore in September, marking a 9.1% annual increase. Concurrently, the GST Council rationalized the tax structure, reducing four slabs to two (5% and 18%) by scrapping the 12% and 28% rates. This landmark reform, effective September 22, 2025, aims to boost consumption and ease household budgets.

items.title: RBI proposes higher lending limits against shares, IPOs
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has proposed sweeping changes to expand banks’ role in capital market lending. The central bank has proposed removing the regulatory ceiling on loans against listed securities and raising the individual lending limit from Rs 20 lakh to Rs 1 crore.

items.title: India proposes easing aircraft leasing conditions in potential boost for IndiGo
items.summary: India's aviation regulator plans to relax rules for airlines to wet lease aircraft, changing "only" to "normally" for emergency situations. This aims to ease capacity constraints, benefiting carriers like IndiGo, which uses Turkish Airlines wet leases. The proposal also permits one-time exemptions from safety score requirements. This significant regulatory shift, open for public consultation, could reshape airline operations.

items.title: NTPC transfers two coal mines to subsidiary NTPC Mining
items.summary: Power giant NTPC announced a company move. It will transfer two coal mines in Jharkhand to its subsidiary, NTPC Mining Limited. This transfer takes effect from October 1, 2025. Chatti Bariatu and Badam coal mines are involved. This action supports India's largest power generator, supplying a quarter of the nation's electricity.

items.title: Runwal Realty plans up to Rs 2,000-cr IPO, files DRHP
items.summary: Runwal Realty plans to raise Rs 2,000 crore through an Initial Public Offer. The company filed its draft prospectus for the equity share sale. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 1,700 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 300 crore. Funds will repay outstanding borrowings. The developer also plans expansion into hospitality.

items.title: Toyota sales up 16% at 31,091 units in September
items.summary: In September 2024, the automaker sold a total of 26,847 units

items.title: European shares flat as healthcare gains counter broader market weakness
items.summary: European shares were flat on Wednesday, with gains in heavyweight healthcare stocks offsetting the decline in the broader market, as investors fretted over a potential delay in the closely-watched U.S. jobs data.

items.title: Beauty, fashion dominate Navratri as D2C sales surge 25%: GoKwik
items.summary: Navratri eCommerce showed beauty and personal care nearly matching fashion sales. Direct-to-consumer commerce surged 25 percent year-on-year. Bracelets emerged as the highest-selling items. Consumers chose higher-value products, increasing average order values by 18 percent. Prepaid orders rose sharply, and cancellations fell. Western and Southern India led this festive surge. This indicates growing trust in online brands.

items.title: 2025 rich list in charts: Mukesh Ambani overtakes Gautam Adani, 24 new billionaires emerge
items.summary: Mukesh Ambani surpassed Gautam Adani as the richest Indian in 2025, the latest Hurun India Rich List showed. However, seven of the 10 wealthiest Indians saw their net worth fall this year.

items.title: Nikkei ends at three-week low on profit-taking as second half of fiscal year begins
items.summary: Japan's Nikkei share average ended at a three-week low on Wednesday in a broad sell-off as investors booked profits from the latest rally at the start of the second half of the fiscal year.

items.title: Adani Green Energy operational capacity reaches 16,598.6 MW
items.summary: Adani Green Energy Limited operationalised 112.5 MW of power projects. These are located at Khavda in Gujarat. This increases its total generation capacity to 16,598.6 MW. A solar project of 87.5 MW and a hybrid project of 25 MW were commissioned. Power generation from these plants will commence from September 30, 2025. The company expands its energy capacity.

items.title: Bollywood’s sequel strategy loses steam, upcoming line-up at risk
items.summary: The Hindi film industry’s sequel strategy is stumbling, with recent flops exposing the limits of cashing in on brand value. Experts warn only strong stories—not recycled franchises—can draw audiences.

items.title: Adani’s road-arm signs deal to acquire 100% stake in 2 highway companies
items.summary: The company, in a regulatory filing with the exchanges, said its subsidiary has executed a share purchase agreement with existing shareholder DRN Infrastructure PVt Ltd for acquiring 100 per cent stake in both these entities

items.title: RBI announces measures to help exporters
items.summary: One of the key measures is the extension of the time period for repatriation from foreign currency accounts of Indian exporters in IFSC, from one month to three months

items.title: India’s IPO market is booming. So why are foreign investors staying away?
items.summary: Foreign institutional investors have pulled back from India’s IPOs due to high valuations and limited upside, opting not to offset their heavy selling in the secondary market. Experts site three conditions for FII optimism in India to stage a comeback.&nbsp;

items.title: Hyundai Motor India shares fall 3% on muted domestic sales in September
items.summary: InCred Equities expects Hyundai Motor India to see limited benefits from the GST rate cut, given its heavy reliance on SUVs, exports, and spares. The brokerage raised FY26F–28F sales estimates by just 3%, versus higher industry upgrades, citing weaker exposure to compact cars. Valuations are now 26% above Maruti Suzuki’s. Hyundai shares have risen 50% in six months.

items.title: Markets bounce back on RBI dovish tone; Nifty Bank leads recovery: Rohit Srivastava
items.summary: Indian equity markets, led by the banking sector, staged a recovery on Tuesday after eight consecutive declines. Analysts believe this signals a sustained rebound, fueled by oversold conditions and the RBI's dovish stance hinting at future rate cuts. Bank Nifty is expected to continue its upward momentum towards 57,000, potentially lasting until Diwali.

items.title: India-EFTA trade pact explained: Tariff cuts, sectoral benefits, and investment commitments
items.summary: India's free trade agreement with the four-nation European Free Trade Association (EFTA) came into effect, aiming to boost commerce and investments. The pact secures a USD 100 billion investment commitment from EFTA over 15 years, potentially creating 1 million jobs in India. This deal offers significant tariff concessions for Indian exports and provides consumers with cheaper EFTA goods.

items.title: Indian pharma Wockhardt seeks US approval for new drug to treat UTIs
items.summary: Wockhardt has submitted a New Drug Application to the USFDA for its novel antibacterial agent, Zidebactam-Cefepime injection. This drug targets complicated urinary tract infections, including those caused by multidrug-resistant Gram-negative bacteria. This marks a significant milestone as the first USFDA NDA for a drug fully discovered and developed by an Indian pharmaceutical company, following successful global Phase III trials.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty 50 edge higher after RBI holds rates steady; banking & financial stocks gain
RBI MPC holds repo rate: Is one more cut coming in FY26? What experts hint?
items.summary: The RBI maintained the repo rate at 5.5% for the second consecutive meeting, revising FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.8%. Experts suggest a cautious approach, hinting at potential future cuts while remaining watchful of external economic impacts.

items.title: RBI proposes big boost to bank lending for shares, IPOs, corporates
items.summary: RBI has also outlined an enabling framework to support corporate acquisitions and proposed scrapping the 2016 restrictions that discouraged lending to large borrowers.

items.title: RBI’s wait-and-watch policy gives banks more flexibility: Nilesh Shah
items.summary: The RBI adopted a cautious yet flexible monetary policy, deferring immediate rate cuts despite divided market expectations. Governor Shah highlighted strong growth and low inflation, while the RBI also enhanced flexibility for Indian banks in capital market exposure to boost domestic investment and corporate restructuring. This offers reassurance, though equity markets will focus elsewhere.

items.title: Vedanta Resources' $500 million dollar-denominated bond issue gets 3 times oversubscription
items.summary: The net proceeds from the offering will be used to repay existing debt and for general corporate purposes

items.title: Small-cap stock under  ₹50 declares 20% final dividend in FY26. Details here
items.summary: Small-cap multibagger stock has been trading in red in the near-term. The stock descended nearly 10 per cent in six months over 94 per cent in one year.

items.title: Earnings Preview: Muted Q2FY26 ahead for IT companies; mid-caps seen outperforming large-caps: Motilal Oswal
items.summary: India's tech firms will announce Q2FY26 results next week, with analysts predicting muted growth due to macroeconomic uncertainties. Large-cap IT companies may see 0.3% to 2.4% growth, while mid-caps are expected to outperform.

items.title: JSW MG Motor India sales up 34 per cent in Sept
items.summary: JSW MG Motor India reported a 34 percent rise in September wholesales, reaching 6,728 units, compared to the same month last year. This significant growth was attributed to a recent GST reduction and the onset of the Navratri festive season, which boosted customer sentiment. Both Internal Combustion Engine and Electric Vehicle models contributed to the strong sales momentum.

items.title: European Bank Stocks Still Hold Appeal After Record Winning Run
items.summary: European banking stocks have just matched their record quarterly winning run and the good news for bulls is that their performance looks far from stretched.

items.title: RBI may reopen licensing window for Urban Cooperative Banks after 20 years
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced that a discussion paper on licensing new UCBs will be released soon.

items.title: How RBI measures will impact Indian banks? Bank Nifty up over 1%
items.summary: The Bank Nifty rose over 1% as the RBI introduced measures to improve credit availability while keeping the repo rate at 5.5%. Key banks like Kotak Mahindra, AXIS, ICICI, and HDFC saw gains of 1%-3%. RBI's initiatives aim to enhance lending and lower financing costs.

items.title: Sensex ends 716 points higher, Nifty breaks 8-day losing streak. Top 6 factors behind the rally
items.summary: Indian markets rebounded on October 1 after eight sessions of losses. The Reserve Bank of India maintained repo rates, revising inflation forecasts lower. This decision supported investor confidence. Bank stocks saw gains as RBI increased loan limits. The Indian rupee strengthened against the US dollar. Falling crude oil prices and positive global cues also contributed to the market surge.

items.title: Paint sector’s new challengers put to the test in tepid festive season
items.summary: Early Diwali and soft consumer demand are testing India’s paint market, with festive-season sales slower than expected..Meanwhile, challengers like Birla Opus and JSW Paints are pressing on the incumbents—navigating distribution, pricing, and margin pressures amid muted growth.

items.title: Pace Digitek IPO allotment: How to check status online, GMP, and listing outlook
items.summary: Investors who applied to Pace Digitek’s Rs 819 crore IPO can expect the basis of allotment to be finalized on October 1. Shares will be credited via the registrar’s portal, with MUFG Intime India handling the process. The company is set to list on the BSE and NSE on October 6, following a fully subscribed IPO.

items.title: Vedanta Resources’ $500 mn dollar bonds attract 3x subscription
items.summary: Vedanta Resources successfully raised $500 million through a seven-year US dollar bond issue, which was oversubscribed three times, attracting bids over USD 1.6 billion. This strategic move, backed by strong investor confidence, is part of the conglomerate's ongoing efforts to repay existing high-cost debt, manage liquidity, and extend its debt maturity profile.

items.title: RBI announces measures to help exporters amid high US tariffs
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India announced steps to support exporters. This action addresses challenges from US tariffs. The RBI extended the repatriation period for foreign currency accounts. It also increased the forex outlay period for trade transactions. Compliance for small exporters and importers saw simplification. These measures aim to improve business operations.

items.title: Credit growth, liquidity boost to support banking sector ahead of Basel III: Dinesh Kumar Khara
items.summary: Indian banks show strong capital and readiness for the ECL framework. Basel III norms become effective from April 2027. Former SBI Chairman notes sufficient preparation time. This transition strengthens the banking system. It boosts investor confidence. The RBI maintains a neutral stance. This marks a new phase for Indian banks.

items.title: Vedanta Group's Sterlite Electric files DRHP with Sebi for an IPO
items.summary: Sterlite Electric, part of the Vedanta Group, has filed its DRHP with Sebi to raise funds through an IPO. The issue includes a fresh equity sale and an offer for sale, each of 77.9 lakh shares. Promoters Anil Agarwal and Twin Star Overseas will participate in the OFS. Proceeds will fund debt repayment, capital expenditure, and general corporate purposes.

items.title: Geoff Dennis sees limited long-term impact from US government shutdown
items.summary: As a US government shutdown nears, investors are evaluating its market impact. A prolonged shutdown could weaken the economy and the dollar, potentially leading to Fed rate cuts and benefiting emerging markets. Gold demand remains strong amid uncertainty, inflation, and a soft dollar, with prices expected to rise further.

items.title: Charts don’t lie! Inside Dalal Street’s stark underperformance
items.summary: India's stock market lags global markets. Valuations are high, and earnings growth is slow. US-India trade issues also affect investor interest. Recent GST cuts and interest rate reductions could provide some support. However, a large earnings improvement is not likely this year. The market may move sideways. Stock picking offers opportunities for investors.

items.title: Charts don’t lie! Inside Dalal Street’s stark underperformance
items.summary: India's stock market lags global markets. Valuations are high, and earnings growth is slow. US-India trade issues also affect investor interest. Recent GST cuts and interest rate reductions could provide some support. However, a large earnings improvement is not likely this year. The market may move sideways. Stock picking offers opportunities for investors.

items.title: ATF price hiked 3%, commercial LPG up ₹15.50
items.summary: The hike follows six-monthly reductions, the last being of ₹51.50 on September 1. In the six reductions, prices were cut by ₹223 per bottle since April.

items.title: RBI to permit banks to fund merger & acquisition activity by Indian corporates
items.summary: RBI to permit banks to fund merger & acquisition activity by Indian corporates

items.title: Deep dive: How reforms & earnings rebound can trigger a market rally
items.summary: India's Nifty has significantly underperformed global markets over the past year, dropping 3.6% while others soared. This follows a post-Covid boom driven by retail investors and strong earnings, which led to stretched valuations. Corporate earnings growth also slowed to 5%.

items.title: Hyundai reports 10% rise in September sales, exports hit 33-month high
items.summary: Hyundai Motor India reported a 10 percent rise in September total sales. Domestic sales reached 51,547 units. Exports surged to 18,800 units, a 33-month high. SUV sales penetration hit 72.4 percent. Creta achieved its highest monthly sales. Venue also saw a 20-month high in volume. The company noted growth in both markets.

items.title: Toyota sales up 16% at 31,091 units in September
items.summary: Toyota Kirloskar Motor reported sales increase. The company sold 31,091 units in September. This was a 16 percent rise year-on-year. Domestic wholesale reached 27,089 units. Exports were 4,002 units. This growth followed GST reforms and the festive season. The company expects performance to continue.

items.title: Bitcoin steady at $114K as dollar weakness boosts crypto demand
items.summary: Bitcoin held steady at $114,603, buoyed by dollar weakness driving investors towards crypto assets. While some altcoins experienced dips, experts urge caution amidst economic uncertainty. Bitcoin needs to breach $114,750 for sustained buying pressure, or it risks testing $112,200 support levels. Ethereum shows bullish short-term momentum but faces significant selling pressure. The market anticipates consolidation before a decisive directional breakout.

items.title: Tata Motors sets October 14 as record date for demerger of CV business
items.summary: Tata Motors fixed October 14, 2025, as the record date for its commercial vehicles demerger. Shareholders will receive one TMLCV share for each Tata Motors share. This restructuring aims for distinct business operations. The new commercial vehicle entity will list on BSE and NSE. This demerger may bring market rebalancing.

items.title: Gold prices jump ₹535 to record ₹1,17,800/10g on U.S. govt shutdown, Fed cut hopes
items.summary: Silver futures also posted strong advances

items.title: UPI payments to be charged? RBI Governor clarifies
items.summary: RBI Guv Sanjay Malhotra confirmed no proposal for UPI charges exists currently, clarifying his earlier remarks on its long-term sustainability. He stressed that while UPI is free due to government subsidies, the system's operational costs must eventually be borne by someone, whether collectively or individually, to ensure its continued viability and growth.

items.title: Indian filmmakers say too early to assess impact of Donald Trump's 100 per cent tariff proposal
items.summary: Trump's announcement of a 100% tariff on foreign-made films has left Indian producers and distributors uncertain about its exact implications. If applied to Indian movies, ticket prices in the US could double, potentially reducing audience turnout. Industry leaders are adopting a wait-and-watch approach, awaiting clarity on implementation and scope, especially for streaming platforms.

items.title: Radhika Gupta advises investors looking to dabble in SIFs: From expected returns, to allocation, evaluation and more
items.summary: Edelweiss MF chief Radhika Gupta explained SIFs to followers on social media, noting that the options vary significantly even within the same category. Her advice? Understand your investment needs before allocating funds.

items.title: Hyundai total sales up 10% in September
items.summary: The company's domestic sales in September stood at 51,547 units, driven by festive demand across all segments

items.title: Mint Explainer | How nuclear power plays a key role in India-US bilateral trade talks
items.summary: Nuclear power is taking centre stage in the India-US trade negotiations as India strives to enhance its nuclear capacity. With ambitious plans to expand from 8.8GW to 100GW by 2047, India seeks global partnerships for small modular reactors (SMRs).&nbsp;

items.title: RBI working on platform to lock phones bought on default loans
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is examining a phone security platform allowing lenders to remotely lock mobile phones of defaulting borrowers. This initiative aims to curb bad assets, though it involves balancing customer data privacy with lenders' interests.

items.title: VinFast partners with Castrol India to enhance EV after-sales service network
items.summary: The collaboration with Castrol India is part of VinFast's strategy to ensure customer confidence and convenience. With the launch of its premium SUVs, VF 6 and VF 7, in India, VinFast is building a service backbone to support its customer base.

items.title: Festive bonanza effect? India’s Reserve Bank has done well by preserving its firepower for later
items.summary: India’s central bank did not budge on its policy rate despite subdued inflation. But then, it also raised its GDP growth forecast. Overall, it has prudently sought to balance optimism with caution in an outlier year marked by fiscal relief and global uncertainty

items.title: HUDCO, PFC, and Ireda shares jump up to 5% as RBI eases infrastructure financing norms
items.summary: Infrastructure financing stocks surged over 5% after the RBI reduced risk weights on NBFC lending to infrastructure projects, aiming to lower financing costs. Concurrently, the RBI kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, revised FY26 inflation downward to 2.6%, and raised the FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.8%.

items.title: No-frills account holders can now access digital banking facility free of cost
items.summary: RBI announced a major change for no-frills account holders. Basic Savings Bank Deposit accounts will now get free digital banking. This includes mobile and internet banking services. The move aims to boost financial inclusion across the nation. Grievance redressal mechanisms are also being strengthened. Rural cooperative banks will join the Ombudsman scheme. This expands essential banking access for many citizens.

items.title: Mahindra Auto sales rise 16% to 1,00,298 units in Sep
items.summary: In the passenger vehicles segment, the company said its utility vehicles dispatch to dealers surged 10 per cent year-on-year to 56,233 units in the domestic market last month

items.title: India ready to rev up chipmaking, industry pioneer says
items.summary: India is aggressively pursuing semiconductor self-reliance, with PM Modi and industry leaders like Vellayan Subbiah driving significant investments and public-private partnerships. Despite a late start and challenges in talent retention, the nation aims to build a complete chip ecosystem, leveraging its vast talent pool and scale to become a global low-cost manufacturing hub.

items.title: Stock markets extend morning gains post RBI policy; sensex jumps nearly 600 points
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on October 1 kept its policy interest rate unchanged at 5.5% for the second consecutive time, citing concerns over tariff uncertainties

items.title: LTTS bags USD 100 million deal from US-based manufacturer
items.summary: L&T Technology Services (LTTS) secured a USD 100 million multi-year agreement with a US-based industrial equipment manufacturer serving the semiconductor value chain. LTTS will support the client in new product development, sustenance engineering, and platform automation, leveraging AI and computer vision. The company will also establish a Centre of Excellence to drive innovation.

items.title: India seeks to hasten hydropower approvals to reach green goals
items.summary: India will outsource geological investigations for hydroelectric projects, including energy storage, to accelerate approvals and its energy transition. This initiative aims to overcome delays caused by short-staffed government agencies. Despite hydropower's critical role, many approved projects face significant delays due to environmental concerns and social resistance, particularly in the fragile Himalayan regions.

items.title: Sensex jumps over 700 points to break 8-day losing streak. What was the good news in RBI policy?
items.summary: Dalal Street celebrated the RBI's expected 'dovish pause' and Governor Malhotra's pro-market initiatives, ending an 8-day losing streak. Sensex surged over 600 points as RBI allowed banks to fund M&A, liberalized loans against shares, and reduced risk weights for infrastructure financing. These measures, coupled with optimistic GDP and inflation forecasts, significantly boosted market sentiment, especially for banking and infrastructure stocks.

items.title: RBI ready with final guidelines on bank subsidiaries
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced the removal of proposed regulatory restrictions on business overlap between banks and their group entities. This decision, a significant relief for banks, now leaves the strategic allocation of business streams to the wisdom of bank boards. Earlier draft norms had aimed to prevent multiple entities within a bank group from undertaking the same permissible business.

items.title: RBI allows local lenders to bankroll mergers & acquisitions
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India proposed a comprehensive framework enabling banks to finance corporate acquisitions, a long-standing demand. It also plans to increase lending limits against shares and ease risk weights on loans to NBFCs for infrastructure projects. These measures aim to broaden capital market lending, reflecting India's maturing financial system.

items.title: 10 Small-cap stocks trading below 5-Year average P/E — rallying up to 100%! Do you own any?
items.summary: Ten small-cap stocks trading below their five-year average P/E have rallied 15–100% in the past three months. While potentially undervalued, investors should consider fundamentals and broader market conditions.

items.title: RBI flags complacency risks, urges PSBs to build stronger capital buffers
items.summary: RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan J urged public sector banks to build stronger capital buffers and manage asset quality proactively, warning against complacency amid global uncertainty. He emphasized their crucial role in India's 2047 vision. Concurrently, the RBI established a new Payments Regulatory Board and revised its liquidity framework to enhance the financial system's resilience.

items.title: RBI take steps to make banks resilient and competitive
items.summary: The RBI has directed large banks to adopt the Expected Credit Loss framework and revised Basel III capital norms from April 1, 2027, with a glide path until 2031. These measures aim to strengthen bank resilience and competitiveness, alongside reducing risk weights on MSME and residential real estate lending. The central bank also plans risk-based deposit insurance premiums.

items.title: RBI announces slew of measures to promote internationalisation of Rupee
items.summary: RBI Governor proposed to establish transparent reference rates for currencies of India’s major trading partners to facilitate INR-based transactions

items.title: THV launches its AI-powered hotel management system, Hotel Superhero, as a SaaS offering for independent hotels
items.summary: Treebo Hospitality Ventures has launched Hotel Superhero, an AI-powered, voice-and-chat based hotel management system for independent hotels. This SaaS offering, starting at Rs 49/room/month, features SuperBot, an AI chat agent that simplifies complex operational tasks via voice commands. The platform aims to empower independent hoteliers with advanced technology to boost profits and streamline operations.

items.title: Why the RBI kept repo rate unchanged today and what a neutral stance means
items.summary: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee kept the repo rate at 5.5% and maintained a neutral stance, despite stable inflation and expectations for a cut. Governor Sanjay Malhotra explained the decision was driven by moderating inflation and the ongoing impact of previous measures. The MPC is closely monitoring economic developments and global uncertainties before charting its next course.

items.title: Smallcap stock below  ₹15 makes a stellar 87% comeback in September after 8-month losing streak. Do you own?
items.summary: Mercury Trade Links shares surged 87% in September, ending an eight-month losing streak. It continued to rise in October, hitting a 5% upper circuit at  ₹12.61 apiece during Wednesday's trade. This marks the 15th straight day that the stock has been locked at the upper price band level.&nbsp;

items.title: Live: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra holds post-MPC press conference
We must navigate the three Ds that will shape our economic future: Deglobalization, derisking and deregulation
items.summary: As global trade faces disruption and uncertainty amid geopolitical tensions, countries are rethinking their strategies. India has taken a nuanced approach. Success will lie in navigating all three Ds well to balance openness with resilience and global integration with domestic strength.

items.title: Festive demand, GST cuts to boost autos and staples: Sanjeev Prasad
items.summary: Sanjeev Prasad anticipates festive demand will boost autos and staples. He expects earnings stability for FY2027 after recent cuts. Nifty 50 may deliver 5-10% returns over the next year. Banks are set to lead economic recovery with 23% profit growth in FY2027. Job creation determines the longevity of the demand cycle.

items.title: Australia's home prices rise at fastest clip in a year as rate cuts fuel demand
items.summary: Australian home prices rose 0.8% in September. This was the fastest monthly gain in a year. Rate cuts and low property listings drove this increase. The national median value reached a record A$857,280. Brisbane and Perth saw strong surges. Sydney prices also increased. A new policy for first home buyers will take effect. Rental markets show record low vacancy rates.

items.title: RBI holds repo rate steady at 5.5% amid economic challenges and adjusts GDP growth forecast
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India kept its policy repo rate unchanged at 5.5% due to tariff challenges, while revising FY26 GDP growth upwards to 6.8%. Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced 22 measures to strengthen the banking sector, including allowing corporate acquisition financing and deferring the ECL framework, aiming to improve credit flow and resilience.

items.title: US shutdown takes effect: Gold price, bond yield to US dollar — how it will impact your investment returns?
items.summary: The US government has shut down after failing to extend federal funding, impacting global markets. Gold prices surged amid the crisis, raising concerns over the dollar's strength. Indian investors are advised to diversify their portfolios amidst volatility and shifting investor behavior.

items.title: Navi Mumbai Airport set to be inaugurated on Oct 8, Gautam Adani visits ahead of opening
items.summary: Adani Group's Navi Mumbai International Airport is scheduled for inauguration by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 8, following multiple delays and recent DGCA license approval. Gautam Adani visited the site, expressing deep gratitude to the diverse workforce. This joint venture aims to significantly reduce congestion at Mumbai airport, initially handling 20 million passengers annually.

items.title: China September new home prices edge up, resale market falls: survey
items.summary: China's housing market continues its struggle, with new home price growth slowing and resale prices falling further in September, a traditionally peak buying month. Despite numerous government support measures, the sector remains mired in a downturn since 2021. Analysts now predict recovery no earlier than late 2026, as weak income expectations and high unemployment deter buyers, impacting broader economic stability.

items.title: RBI to roll out risk-based deposit insurance premium model from FY26
items.summary: At present, banks pay a uniform premium of 12 paise per ₹100 of assessable deposits under the DICGC scheme, which has been operational since 1962

items.title: RBI MPC: Malhotra & co flag US tariffs as key headwind for Indian exports and growth
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India recently kept its repo rate unchanged. Global trade uncertainties and US tariffs pose significant external risks to India's growth. The central bank notes these tariffs could reduce India's exports. Domestic reforms may offer some mitigation. Tariffs could raise US inflation by 2025. Other regions may see lower inflation.

items.title: Japan's shorter-end bond yields edge down as US government shuts down
items.summary: Japan's shorter-dated government bond yields fell as investors sought safe-haven assets following the US government shutdown. The two-year and ten-year JGBs saw slight declines amidst global uncertainties. Concurrently, a Bank of Japan survey revealed improved manufacturer confidence, heightening prospects for an interest rate hike as early as this month, though market reaction to the survey was limited.

items.title: Hindustan Zinc to Bharti Airtel- Jay Thakkar suggests three stocks to buy or sell for short-term in F&O segment
items.summary: Indian stocks rose on Wednesday after the central bank maintained interest rates. The Nifty 50 and Sensex saw increases, while bank shares benefited from relaxed lending rules. Analysts suggest buying Hindustan Zinc and Bank of Baroda futures, while recommending selling Bharti Airtel futures.

items.title: Gold prices jump ₹535 to record ₹1,17,800/10g on US govt shutdown, Fed cut hopes
items.summary: The February contract extended the rally for fifth straight session by rising ₹617 or 0.52 per cent to hit a lifetime high of ₹1,19,055 per 10 grams.

items.title: India's central bank proposes to boost international usage of rupee
items.summary: India's central bank proposed measures to boost the rupee's global use, including allowing local banks to lend in rupees to businesses in neighboring countries for trade. It will also establish reference exchange rates and permit foreign entities to invest surplus vostro account rupee balances in corporate bonds and commercial papers.

items.title: RBI steps in before rate decision with rupee teetering near all-time low, traders say
items.summary: India's central bank intervened in currency markets on Wednesday, selling dollars through state-run banks to support the rupee. This action occurred ahead of a crucial policy decision, with traders anticipating a potential rate cut. The rupee, which opened slightly higher at 88.7750 per dollar, was lifted from its all-time low near 88.

items.title: FatakSecure gets IRDAI nod for composite corporate agent license
items.summary: This authorisation enables FatakSecure to formally operate and expand its insurance vertical, offering motor, health, accident, life, corporate, and consumable insurance

items.title: Bajaj Auto sales up 9% in September
items.summary: Total domestic sales, including commercial vehicles, stood at 3,25,252 units last month, as compared to 3,11,887 units in the year-ago period

items.title: Eight IPOs debut today:  Jain Resource Recycling surges, EPack, BMW Ventures, Gurunanak Agriculture fall on listing
items.summary: Eight IPOs, including Jain Resource Recycling’s strong debut, faced mixed outcomes. While Jain rose 14%, others like BMW Ventures and EPack Prefab struggled on their market entrance

items.title: RBI hikes limit for loan against shares to Rs 1 crore, IPO financing to Rs 25 lakh
items.summary: RBI raises credit limits: Loan against shares ceiling hiked from Rs 20 lakh to Rs 1 crore, and IPO financing limit increased to Rs 25 lakh. Governor Sanjay Malhotra said these measures, part of five steps to boost credit, follow a 100-bps rate cut in 2025.

items.title: Sensex jumps 700 points after RBI keeps rates unchanged. What drove the Indian stock market higher? EXPLAINED
items.summary: On October 1, the Indian stock market saw strong buying across segments after the RBI's MPC decided to maintain the repo rate and policy stance unchanged for the second consecutive meeting, following a 50 basis point cut in June.

items.title: Fabtech Technologies IPO, OM Freight Forwarders IPO – Day 3: Check GMP, subscription status, and key details
items.summary: Fabtech Technologies and OM Freight Forwarders are in their third day of IPO bidding. By Day 2, Fabtech achieved full subscription, while OM Freight Forwarders saw 2.23 times oversubscription. Fabtech's GMP stands at 1%, indicating moderate interest, whereas OM Freight's stronger 2.2% GMP reflects higher investor confidence.

items.title: Proposed bar on overlap in businesses undertaken by a bank and its group entity being removed: RBI Guv Malhotra
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the draft guidelines on forms of business and investment for banks, issued in October 2024, have been finalised and will be issued shortly

items.title: Bajaj reports 9 pc growth in sales in September
items.summary: Bajaj Auto reported a strong 9% year-on-year growth in total sales for September, reaching 5,10,504 units. The automobile manufacturer witnessed a 4% increase in domestic sales, including commercial vehicles, while exports surged by an impressive 18%. Domestic two-wheeler sales also climbed 5% compared to the same month last year, indicating robust performance across key segments.

items.title: boAt elevates COO Gaurav Nayyar as CEO
items.summary: Imagine Marketing, the parent company of audio and wearable brand boAt, has appointed current COO Gaurav Nayyar as its new CEO, succeeding co-founder Sameer Mehta, who moves to the Executive Director role.

items.title: RBI MPC Outcome: PSU bank stocks slide up to 1.5% after RBI holds rates steady at 5.5%
items.summary: PSU bank stocks fell up to 1.4% on Wednesday after RBI kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% and maintained a neutral stance. The Nifty PSU Bank index slipped 0.78% to 7,468, with Indian Bank, Canara Bank, and PNB among the top decliners. SBI and Bank of Baroda also dipped, despite RBI raising FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.8%.

items.title: India’s manufacturing growth cools in September as costs surge, US tariffs add strain
items.summary: India’s manufacturing growth slowed in September after hitting a 17-year high, as soaring input costs and US tariffs strained factory activity. Despite cooling momentum, optimism stayed firm on GST cuts and resilient global demand outside the US.

items.title: Most Indians sit out, finfluencers rule the 10% who dare to play the stock market, says Sebi survey
items.summary: The Sebi investor survey reveals 62% of investors act on finfluencer advice, with 93% rating them as highly credible, highlighting a potential risk amid widespread market fear and investor knowledge gaps.

items.title: RBI unveils new measures for internationalisation of Indian Rupee
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India announced new steps to boost the Indian Rupee's global use. Banks will now lend Rupees to non-residents in Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka for trade. The RBI plans to create clear reference rates for major trading partner currencies. Special Rupee Vostro Account balances will become eligible for corporate bond and commercial paper investments.

items.title: 'Very wrong decision...': Mohandas Pai questions RBI for not cutting rates amid falling inflation
items.summary: RBI Policy Meeting: TV Mohandas Pai critiques the RBI's decision to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, arguing it contradicts easing inflation trends. He warns that this could lead India toward a rent-seeking economy, hindering investments and economic growth.

items.title: Pocket FM taps Goldman Sachs to raise up to $150 million for global expansion, AI push
items.summary: The audio streaming platform has formally begun its $100-150 million fundraise with the appointment of Goldman Sachs. Pocket FM is looking to strengthen its overseas operations, expand its content IP, and leverage AI.

items.title: Netweb Technologies shares surge 13% to record high, rally 170% in 6 months! Here’s why
items.summary: Shares of Netweb Technologies surged to a record Rs 4,108 on the NSE, up 13%, extending a rally of 80% in a month and 170% in six months. The stock’s momentum is driven by India’s digital infrastructure growth, AI adoption, data localisation policies, and major order wins, including Nvidia-powered server contracts and Tyrone GPU-accelerated AI systems.

items.title: FY26: RBI ups GDP growth projection by 30 bps; cuts retail inflation projection by 50 bps
items.summary: Even though the growth projection for the financial year 2025-26 is being revised upwards, the forward-looking projections for Q3 and beyond are expected to be slightly lower than projected earlier

items.title: Anand Rathi Share and Stock Brokers shares rally 13% from IPO price in 2 days as investor demand stays strong
items.summary: Anand Rathi shares surged up to 12.7% driven by strong retail participation and positive market sentiment. Intraday gains of 4.7% reflect investor optimism and confidence in the company’s growth outlook and fundamentals.

items.title: Rate-sensitive stocks rise after RBI keeps repo rate unchanged; bank, financial services sectors lead gains
items.summary: Rate-sensitive sectors rose after the RBI held the repo rate at 5.5%. The central bank revised FY26 GDP growth to 6.8% and inflation to 2.6%. Stock markets gained, with Nifty Bank and Financial Services leading, while broader indices underperformed.

items.title: RBI proposes four big measures to boost India's banking system
items.summary: The RBI proposed significant reforms to bolster India's banking sector, introducing risk-based deposit insurance premiums and an Expected Credit Loss provisioning framework from April 2027. Revised Basel III capital norms will also be implemented, reducing capital requirements for MSMEs and home loans, aligning regulations with global standards.

items.title: Is the share market closed for Maha Navami holiday today?
items.summary: Stock Market Closed today; On October 1, 2025, Indian stock and commodity markets are open for Maha Navami. Key October trading holidays and Diwali Muhurat session are noted; markets begin October cautiously ahead of RBI MPC meet.

items.title: ‘Gold’en era for precious metals: Gold hits Rs 1,17,800, silver at Rs 1,44,844. What’s powering the rally?
items.summary: Gold and silver prices on MCX surged to new all-time highs on Wednesday, fueled by strong global safe-haven demand amidst U.S. government shutdown fears and expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts. International spot prices also reached record levels, with experts advising investors to wait for corrective dips before initiating fresh long positions.

items.title: India’s Real GDP expected to grow at 6.8%, inflation estimated at 2.6% for FY26: RBI
Tata Investment Corp shares surge over 45% in 7 sessions. Should you book profit or accumulate?
items.summary: Tata Investment Corporation shares have surged over 45% in seven sessions, hitting a record Rs 10,611 on strong technical momentum and expectations of Tata Sons’ listing and Tata Capital IPO. Experts suggest holding or accumulating on dips amid near-term volatility.

items.title: Mahindra sales up 16% to 1,00,298 units in September
items.summary: Mahindra & Mahindra announced robust overall auto sales of 100,298 vehicles in September 2025, achieving a 16% growth. Utility Vehicle sales grew 10% to 56,233 units domestically, driven by GST reforms and pent-up demand. However, SUV dispatches faced constraints due to trailer availability issues during the month's latter half, despite strong festive season retail growth.

items.title: India's September manufacturing growth cools as price rises soar to 12-year high, PMI shows
items.summary: The slowdown was led by a moderation in new orders and output, which expanded at the weakest rate in four months

items.title: BMW Ventures shares list at over 21% discount over IPO price
items.summary: BMW Ventures made a weak debut on bourses, listing at a significant discount after its moderately subscribed IPO. Despite a strong distribution network and diversified products, the company faces challenges with thin margins and a high valuation. Its future trajectory hinges on improving profitability and reducing debt in a competitive market.

items.title: MPC keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.5%, revises growth forecast upwards to 6.8%, inflation projected at 2.6%for FY26
items.summary: Consequently, the standing deposit facility (SDF) rate remains at 5.25% while the marginal standing facility (MSF) rate and the Bank Rate remain at 5.75%

items.title: Twin depressions extend India’s monsoon into October, IMD forecasts heavy rain
items.summary: A depression to pop up over north-east Arabian Sea later today and over Bay of Bengal by tomorrow

items.title: MPC maintains status quo on repo rate and stance
items.summary: Governor Sanjay Malhotra said overall inflation outlook has turned even more benign due to sharp decline in food prices and GST rate rationalisation even as he emphasised that growth continues to be below the central bank’s aspirations

items.title: Fed’s Collins signals openness to more rate cuts
India's September manufacturing growth cools as price rises soar to 12-year high, PMI shows
items.summary: India's manufacturing expansion slowed last month. It remained strong. Input costs rose at a rate not seen in nearly 12 years. Firms increased selling prices at a rate not seen since October 2013. US tariffs could affect the economy. New export orders grew. Business confidence reached a seven-month high. Tax relief from GST changes supported optimism.

items.title: L&T Technology Services secures $100 million multi-year deal
items.summary: LTTS will set-up a Center of Excellence (CoE) to support the client in accelerating innovation, simplifying platforms, application engineering and transitioning towards a more digital and AI-enabled future.

items.title: A few dollars less for Indian films coming to America
items.summary: President Trump's 100% tariff on foreign films is set to severely impact US revenues for Indian cinema. Distributors anticipate raising ticket prices, potentially reducing audience footfalls and eroding revenue shares, especially given the short theatrical window before streaming. This move could wipe out 40% of US revenues and force Indian producers to reassess their distribution strategies.

items.title: RBI MPC 2025: Central bank unveils five measures to boost credit flow, reduce financing costs
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India announced measures to boost credit flow. The key repo rate remained unchanged. Banks will gain frameworks for corporate acquisition financing. Capital market lending limits will increase significantly. A 2016 framework for large borrowers was scrapped. Risk weights for infrastructure lending will reduce. Licensing for urban cooperative banks may resume soon.

items.title: India extends timeline to roll out algo trading rules for retail investors (Sept 30)
items.summary: INDIA-SEBI-ALGO-TRADING:India extends timeline to roll out algo trading rules for retail investors (Sept 30)

items.title: RBI keeps policy rate unchanged at 5.5% amid tariff concerns
items.summary: The Monetary Policy Committee, chaired by RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra, unanimously decided to maintain a neutral stance.

items.title: Why RBI did not cut rate? Governor Malhotra explains
India’s Russian oil imports ease in September amid US talks
items.summary: India's oil imports from Russia slightly decreased in September, yet still accounted for a third of its total shipments, despite US efforts to reduce these flows. New Delhi continues to prioritize price-driven deals, with Russian crude remaining attractive due to discounts. India balances economic advantage with geopolitical considerations, while also exploring diversified energy sources.

items.title: India’s Russian oil imports ease in September amid US talks
items.summary: India's oil imports from Russia slightly decreased in September, yet still accounted for a third of its total shipments, despite US efforts to reduce these flows. New Delhi continues to prioritize price-driven deals, with Russian crude remaining attractive due to discounts. India balances economic advantage with geopolitical considerations, while also exploring diversified energy sources.

items.title: BMW Ventures shares list at sharp 21% discount to IPO price
items.summary: BMW Ventures shares debuted on Wednesday. The stock listed at a steep discount on both exchanges. It opened at Rs 78 on NSE and Rs 80 on BSE against the issue price of Rs 99. The Rs 231.66 crore IPO received moderate investor interest. Institutional buyers showed strong demand. Retail investors' participation was lukewarm. The company trades steel products and manufactures PVC pipes.

items.title: India's forex reserves at $700.2 bn as of Sept 26, sufficient for 11 months of merchandise imports: RBI
items.summary: Reserve Bank of India Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced India's forex reserves reached $700.2 billion. The repo rate remains at 5.5 percent. The Monetary Policy Committee revised the GDP growth forecast for FY2025-26 to 6.8 percent. Quarterly growth projections for FY26 were also provided. The RBI monitors the rupee and intervenes to maintain market order.

items.title: Bikaner solar project reaches 629.9 MW capacity after latest SJVN commissioning
items.summary: The Bikaner Solar Project, being developed by SJVN Green Energy, a wholly-owned subsidiary of SJVN, is a key renewable energy initiative aimed at bolstering India’s solar generation capacity.

items.title: NHPC to commission 85.72 MW solar capacity at Bikaner project by Oct-end
items.summary: The Karnisar Solar Power Project, a key part of NHPC’s renewable energy expansion, is crucial for meeting India’s solar capacity targets

items.title: Chennai net leasing to scale two decade high in 2025
items.summary: Chennai's commercial office market is poised for a historic high in 2025, driven by robust leasing momentum and strong occupier demand. The city has already seen a two-decade high in absorption, with Global Capability Centres and peripheral business districts fueling this surge despite tight supply conditions. This positions Chennai as a resilient market.

items.title: RBI Policy Outcome: Central bank raises FY26 GDP growth outlook to 6.8% despite Trump tariffs
items.summary: India's central bank, the Reserve Bank of India, raised the overall growth forecasts for the fiscal year 2025-26 (FY26) at the bi-monthly policy meeting, even though it lowered projections for the second half of the fiscal year amid the Trump tariff impact.

items.title: RBI monetary policy: Repo rate unchanged, growth outlook revised— 5 key highlights from RBI MPC outcome
items.summary: RBI monetary policy: Meeting Street expectations, RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra-led Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the repo rate unchanged at 5.5 per cent, and maintained the policy stance as ‘neutral’.

items.title: Sunny Agrawal flags overpriced unlisted stocks amid IPO frenzy
items.summary: Market experts are urging caution for investors in the unlisted space, as valuations for companies with strong brands often appear stretched. Many current IPOs are fully priced, offering limited listing gains for new investors. Proper valuation analysis, rather than brand names alone, remains crucial for successful navigation.

items.title: Rupee recovers 15 paise from all-time low to 88.65 against U.S. dollar post RBI monetary policy
items.summary: At the interbank foreign exchange, the rupee opened at 88.79 against the U.S. dollar before inching up to 88.75, higher by 5 paise from its previous close

items.title: Singapore Stops 1MDB Liquidators from Suing StanChart, BSI Bank
items.summary: Singapore’s High Court has stopped foreign liquidators from suing Standard Chartered Plc and BSI Bank Ltd. over transactions allegedly linked to the Malaysian sovereign wealth fund 1Malaysia Development Bhd.

items.title: Epack Prefab Technologies shares list at 10% discount to IPO price on exchanges
items.summary: Epack Prefab Technologies debuted at a discount on Wednesday, listing below its IPO price and grey market expectations. Despite healthy financial growth and a strong order book, analysts deemed its 34.5x earnings valuation expensive, leaving limited room for near-term upside. Investors will monitor its expansion plans and margin sustainability.

items.title: RBI holds rates, raises FY26 GDP growth forecast amid tariff headwinds
items.summary: A Reuters poll had forecast rates would likely remain on hold, although some economists had highlighted subdued inflation and risks to growth as reasons for a potential cut.

items.title: RBI Inflation FY2025-26: MPC lowers inflation aim to 2.6%, thanks to GST rationalisation
items.summary: RBI Inflation 2025-26:  The RBI's MPC projects inflation to moderate further in FY26 to 2.6%, supported by GST cuts and favourable food prices, despite a recent quickening in retail inflation. The committee unanimously kept repo rates unchanged and maintained a neutral stance to aid growth, while cautioning about geopolitical tensions and crude oil price risks.

items.title: RBI GDP growth 2025: Central bank raises FY26 growth forecast to 6.8%
items.summary: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee revised India's FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.8%, up from 6.5%, while keeping the repo rate unchanged. This optimism, driven by domestic demand and reforms, contrasts with the Asian Development Bank's lowered projection of 6.5% for FY26, citing significant US tariffs on Indian exports and global uncertainties.

items.title: BMW Ventures shares list at 21% discount over IPO price
items.summary: BMW Ventures share price listed at  ₹78 apiece on NSE and  ₹76 apiece on BSE, as compared to the IPO price of  ₹94 to  ₹99 per share.

items.title: Rupee recovers 5 paise to 88.75 against US dollar in early trade
items.summary: US President Donald Trump's constant pressure over India's Russian oil purchases have dampened the rupee sentiment and affected the overall equity market sentiment

items.title: Tata Motors demerger takes effect. From record date to swap ratio, here’s what investors need to know
items.summary: Tata Motors’ demerger takes effect on October 1, splitting its commercial vehicle and passenger vehicle businesses into two listed entities. Shareholders will receive one share in the new CV company per existing share, with listings expected by mid-November, enabling independent valuation and trading.

items.title: RBI MPC Policy: Central bank revises inflation estimate downwards to 2.6% for FY26
items.summary: RBI MPC Policy: The RBI has revised its inflation forecast for 2025-2026 to 2.6%, down from 3.1%. CPI inflation for Q1 FY27 is projected at 4.5%. The MPC maintained the policy repo rate at 5.50% and adopted a neutral stance amid balanced risks.

items.title: RBI Monetary Policy: Repo rate remains unchanged at 5.5%; FY26 GDP growth forecast raised to 6.8%
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced on October 1 that the repo rate remains at 5.5 percent with a neutral policy stance. This decision follows the same approach taken in August. The SDF rate is unchanged at 5.25 percent, and the MSF rate and Bank Rate remain at 5.75 percent.

items.title: RBI MPC keeps repo rate unchanged at 5.5%; growth and inflation projections revised
items.summary: RBI MPC Repo Rate Change: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee unanimously kept the repo rate at 5.5% and maintained a neutral stance, adopting a wait-and-watch approach amidst US tariffs and geopolitical developments. This decision follows 100 basis points of cuts earlier this year. Goldman Sachs anticipates a further 25 bps cut in December, citing benign inflation and a dovish Fed outlook.

items.title: Epack Prefab IPO listing: Shares debut at a 10% discount on NSE. Details here

items.summary: Jain Resource Recycling debuted strongly on October 1, listing at  ₹265.05 on NSE and  ₹265.25 on BSE, reflecting gains of 14.25% and 14.33% from its IPO price of  ₹232. The IPO was oversubscribed 16.76 times, indicating robust investor interest.

items.title: Jain Resource Recycling shares list at 14% premium over IPO price

The non-ferrous metal recycler, despite rapid financial growth, faces challenges in sustaining growth and expanding its thin 3% net margin post-listing.

items.summary: Relentless selling, meanwhile, has left India's benchmark Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex trailing their regional counterparts this year, rising only 4.1% and 2.7% versus a 22% uptick in Asian and 24.6% jump in emerging market peers

items.title: Marlboro magic: How Godfrey Phillips shares doubled money in 2025 while ITC sulked in a corner
items.summary: Godfrey Phillips is challenging ITC's dominance in the Indian cigarette market, with Marlboro's aggressive rollout capturing younger, aspirational smokers. While ITC stock has fallen, Godfrey Phillips shares have seen a massive surge, driven by superior volume and revenue growth. This shift highlights rising competitive intensity and market share loss for the incumbent.

items.title: PSU banks outshine private lenders; Tata Elxsi, Coforge among top IT picks: Dipan Mehta
items.summary: Investment expert Dipan Mehta shares market insights. Public sector banks present strong financial opportunities. Mehta suggests caution regarding metals and largecap IT stocks. Investors may consider these sector recommendations.

In the mainboard space, 16 out of 31 companies now trade below their issue price, highlighting the challenges of recent offerings.

The agreement includes a $70 billion investment in R&D and domestic manufacturing, a three-year tariff grace period, and participation in the White House’s TrumpRx platform launching in 2026, offering many treatments at an average 50% discount.

items.summary: RBI MPC Meeting 2025-26 Key Takeaways: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee unanimously kept key lending rates, including the repo rate at 5.5%, unchanged, adopting a wait-and-watch approach amidst global uncertainties. While current inflation is low, projections indicate a future rise. Governor Malhotra also announced 22 measures to bolster the banking sector's resilience and enhance credit flow.

items.summary: The central government's H2FY26 borrowing outlook reveals a strategy to manage costs and spreads while borrowing heavily. It prioritizes 10-year and shorter-term securities, reducing ultra-long bonds. The plan also utilizes switch auctions to spread repayments and maintain market stability.

items.summary: Tata Motors Demerger LIVE Updates: The long-anticipated split of Tata Motors Ltd. into its commercial vehicle division and passenger vehicle division will come into effect on October 1.

items.summary: The RBI kept the repo rate at 5.5% with a neutral stance, citing low inflation and strong GDP growth of 7.8% in Q1:2025-26. Moderate inflation, a good monsoon, and GST reforms support the economy, while global uncertainties and trade risks may affect growth in H2:2025-26.

items.title: RBI MPC at a glance: Your one-stop guide for all key decisions
items.summary: The RBI’s 57th MPC meeting from 29 September to 1 October 2025 kept the repo rate at 5.5% with a neutral stance, citing strong GDP growth of 7.8% in Q1:2025-26, low inflation at 2.1% in August, and supportive GST reforms. While domestic demand remains robust, the MPC noted external risks from trade uncertainties and geopolitical tensions. Minutes will be released on 15 October 2025, with the next meeting on 3–5 December 2025.

items.title: Health foods go mainstream as urban Indians demand nutritional choices
items.summary: Health trends in India are broadening as more consumers adopt protein-rich foods like ragi chips and foxnuts. Companies are also capitalizing on this demand with offerings such as protein shakes and oat cookies.

items.summary: RateGain Travel Technologies will acquire US-based Sojern Inc. and its subsidiaries for $250 million in an all-cash deal via its UK arm. Sojern, which reported $172.2 million revenue in 2024, offers AI-driven marketing solutions for the travel and hospitality sector. The acquisition aims to expand RateGain’s suite of offerings and is subject to regulatory approvals.

items.summary: Tata Motors share price: Tata Motors’ demerger takes effect on October 1, splitting its commercial and passenger vehicle businesses into two independent entities. The PV arm becomes Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles Ltd, while the CV segment will list separately as Tata Motors Ltd, with shareholders receiving shares in a 1:1 ratio.

items.summary: Bharti Airtel share price: Bharti Airtel has partnered with Swift Navigation to launch India’s first AI/ML-powered cloud-based precise positioning service, offering centimetre-level location accuracy. The solution targets smart tolling, autonomous vehicles, logistics, railways, and agriculture, with initial deployment in NCR and plans for nationwide expansion.

The Indian Railways has a key role in creating an ecosystem that delivers a vibrant market for private cargo services.

items.summary: The Chennai-headquartered company has identified hydraulic cylinders as a strategic growth area, aiming to strengthen its global presence in this segment.

items.summary:

The rebound came after an eight-day losing streak, with strong buying in bank stocks lifting sentiment. At 1:21 p.m., the BSE Sensex rose 538 points to 80,805, while the NSE Nifty gained 160 points to 24,771.
