items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks closed on October 1 for Maha Navami and Durga Puja? Check full schedule here
items.summary: This week, various parts of India will observe bank holidays for Durga Puja, Navratri, and Gandhi Jayanti. October 2025 will feature 21 official bank holidays, including religious festivities and weekend leaves.

items.title: Lloyds’s new steel bet faces a trifecta of challenges—demand, costs, and Maoists
items.summary: Lloyds Metals and Energy is pushing into primary steelmaking for the first time, banking on captive mines and power even as global steel demand and prices weaken, logistics costs soar, and its projects sit in insurgency-prone districts.

items.title: IndusInd Bank derivatives scandal: Key dealer’s sudden exit under cops' scanner
items.summary: Mumbai Police are investigating alleged accounting irregularities at IndusInd Bank, scrutinizing the hurried exit of senior dealer Pushkar Gondane. Gondane, central to controversial derivative trades, quit in December 2024 just before the probe intensified and subsequently moved abroad. His departure is being examined for links to malpractices that caused a record quarterly loss for the private lender.

items.title: Japan's MUFG set sights on 20% stake in Shriram Finance for $2.6 billion
items.summary: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG) is in advanced talks to acquire a 20% stake in Shriram Finance for ₹23,200 crore ($2.6 billion), potentially the largest FDI in an Indian NBFC. The investment would be via a primary issuance, with MUFG open to a larger stake over time. Shriram Finance, India’s second-largest NBFC, has ₹2.72 lakh crore AUM and a strong retail lending presence.

items.title: Brazil Regulator Agrees to Keep Amazon Soy Ban Through 2025
items.summary: Brazil’s antitrust regulator ruled in favor of major soybean traders, saying companies including Cargill Inc. and Bunge Global SA are allowed to continue a pact that boycotts crops from recently deforested land in the Amazon.

items.title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
items.summary: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

items.title: Trump Says His Administration ‘Reached a Deal’ With Harvard
items.summary: President Donald Trump told reporters his administration had “reached a deal with Harvard” on Tuesday, in what would potentially defuse one of the highest-profile fights between his administration and US education.

items.title: Home loan weakness a drag on retail credit
items.summary: Industry executives attributed the slowdown to relative reluctance among banks, especially those privately owned, to chase housing loans because of the pressure on margins due to reduction in interest rate, while borrowers are delaying purchases in anticipation of further easing of rates. The slowdown also partly reflects the base effect given last year's numbers had the lingering impact of the HDFC-HDFC Bank merger.

items.title: Rupee loan average rates fall by 6bps in August
items.summary: On outstanding rupee loans, system-wide average lending rates softened by 6 bps month-on-month to 9.32% as of end-August. Private sector lenders reduced rates the most, by 10 bps to 10.22%, while PSU banks trimmed rates by 3 bps to 8.70%. Lending rates of foreign banks remained unchanged.

items.title: Vedanta demerger date moved to March 2026 pending government approval
items.summary: Vedanta Ltd has extended its demerger deadline to March 2026 from September 2025, citing pending NCLT and government approvals. This strategic move aims to unlock greater value by creating four standalone companies. The company recently received a boost when NCLAT allowed TSPL's separation, following a settlement with a Chinese contractor.

items.title: RBI to continue to use overnight weighted average call rate as the operating target for monetary policy
items.summary: It would, however, track other overnight money market segments in a bid to ensure orderly evolution of money market rates and smoothen transmission, the central bank said in the revised liquidity management framework released on Tuesday. "The Reserve Bank will endeavour to align the WACR to the policy repo rate by ensuring optimum level of system liquidity using the instruments defined under this framework," the central bank said.

items.title: Cinema chain PVR INOX faces CCI investigation over fair trade breach
items.summary: The Competition Commission of India has ordered an investigation into PVR INOX. This follows a complaint from a movie producers' body. PVR INOX allegedly charges a digital cinema equipment fee. Producers claim this fee is unfair as the digital transition is complete. The CCI director general will investigate the matter. A report is due in 90 days.

items.title: Probe begins after children die of 'toxic' cough syrup
items.summary: India's drug regulator is investigating child deaths in Rajasthan. Several children died after consuming a "toxic" cough syrup. The Jaipur-based Kayson Pharma manufactured this syrup. Samples are now undergoing testing at a government laboratory. Rajasthan Medical Services Corporation Limited halted the syrup's supply. Two batches are under scrutiny. This follows similar incidents with India-made cough syrups in 2022.

items.title: River Mobility plans $150 mn fundraise to expand production
items.summary: River Mobility, an electric two-wheeler maker, plans to raise $150 million (₹1,332 crore) over the next 2-3 years, with the first tranche expected soon, co-founder and CEO Aravind Mani said. The funds will support launching at least one new product annually from FY27, expanding production capacity, and growing its distribution network.

items.title: Ethical fashion label Stella McCartney ties up with Reliance
items.summary: Reliance Brands partners with Stella McCartney to bring the luxury brand to India. The brand uses animal-free materials. Standalone stores will open in six months. Online sales start soon on Ajio Luxe. This targets India's growing luxury market. The market may reach 90 billion dollars by 2030.

items.title: Bayer seeks approval for key heart drug in India
items.summary: Pharmaceutical major Bayer has filed for Indian approval of its patented drug finerenone (Kerendia) to treat heart failure patients with LVEF of 40 and above. This move aims to address India's growing early-onset heart disease burden. Already approved for chronic kidney disease, Bayer anticipates approval for this new indication by year-end, following successful trials.

items.title: Government reports fiscal gap at 38.1% of FY26 target as of August
items.summary: The Centre's fiscal deficit widened to 38.1% of the annual target by August, driven by higher spending, particularly on capital projects, and lower net tax collections. While front-loading expenditure, the government aims to meet its FY26 deficit target, potentially moderating spending and hoping for improved tax mop-up in coming months.

items.title: India sales of Bvlgari may hit a high this year in difficult global environment, says CEO
items.summary: Bvlgari could see a record year in India in 2025, CEO Jean-Christophe Babin told ET, despite global market challenges. The brand’s India-focused products, including collaborations with Priyanka Chopra like the Kada and Mangalsutra, have performed strongly.

items.title: Grocery, electronics goods sales dip in Sept quarter despite GST boost
items.summary: Sales of large grocery packs, soft drinks and electronics declined 5-25% in the September quarter. Consumers deferred purchases anticipating lower GST-linked prices. This resulted in a weak Q2, though industry executives expect a recovery in the coming quarters as GST benefits stabilise.

items.title: Indian Cricket's gen-next are fast becoming brand favourites with Shubman Gill, Suryakumar Yadav leading the way
items.summary: With Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma retiring from multiple formats, India’s younger cricketers are stepping into the endorsement spotlight. Stars like Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav are seeing surges in brand value, commanding fees of ₹5 crore and ₹1.5 crore per day, respectively, while emerging players Abhishek Sharma and Tilak Varma are also gaining traction with brands targeting Gen-Z audiences.

items.title: ADB projects India growth at 6.5% for two fiscal years
items.summary: The ADB forecasts India's economic growth at 6.5% for FY26 and FY27, a cut from previous estimates due to high US tariffs on Indian goods. While tariffs will impede growth, strong domestic demand and service exports are expected to cushion the impact, maintaining India's position as a leading regional economy.

items.title: India must grow 12% to address job-skill mismatch: Morgan Stanley
items.summary: India's economy must grow by 12.2% annually to tackle underemployment. This is double the current pace. A 7.4% growth rate is needed to maintain stable unemployment. Youth unemployment remains high at 17.6%. Morgan Stanley projects 6.5% growth, but this may not create enough jobs. AI could also curb future job growth, especially in IT services.

items.title: Self-reliance in focus to counter weaponisation of trade: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to self-reliance, strengthening supply chains to prevent trade weaponization. He positioned India as a top global investment destination, a stable and rapidly growing economy amidst global volatility. With GDP soaring to 7.8% and recent GST reforms simplifying taxes, India aims to boost consumer spending and economic confidence, while fulfilling its international obligations.

items.title: E-commerce firms under scrutiny for raising prices instead of passing GST cuts
items.summary: The government is closely monitoring e-commerce platforms for failing to pass on GST rate reductions to consumers, with some firms already pulled up for price hikes. Authorities are investigating nearly 3,000 complaints received by the National Consumer Helpline regarding misleading discounts and unfair trade practices post-GST implementation, considering potential class action.

items.title: Government extends RoDTEP by six months to support exporters
items.summary: The government extended the RoDTEP Scheme for exporters. This export support measure was prolonged until March 2026. The scheme refunded taxes and duties to boost export competitiveness. This extension provided relief to exporters facing global challenges. It ensured policy continuity for planning future exports. The move helped sustain momentum in the trade environment.

items.title: Tata Sons listing deadline expires; RBI decision on CIC deregistration awaited
items.summary: Sources suggest an extension may be under consideration, but no official word has been given

items.title: Telecom spectrum auctions see little competition. Regulator proposes a fix
items.summary: Aggressive bidding for spectrum has eased since 2021, with most of the airwaves sold near reserve prices. Trai suggests allowing entities like providers of internet services and connected data networks to bid for airwaves.

items.summary: Jindal Power gets CCI nod to acquire debt-ridden Jaiprakash Associates

Stamp duty revenue surged 44% to Rs 1,266 crore. This performance defied the traditional slowdown during Pitrupaksha. Strong homebuyer sentiment drove this growth.

items.title: Bombay High Court dismisses MIDC petition against Embassy Developments on Nashik SEZ land

items.title: E-commerce under watch: Are GST cuts really reaching shoppers?

But what if prices don’t reflect the lower GST rate because sellers raised the base price?

items.title: India initiates anti-dumping probe into imports of Chinese PET films, kitchen glassware and nylon

These probes follow complaints from domestic manufacturers. They allege cheap imports from China and other nations. DGTR will determine if dumping caused injury. The finance ministry makes final decisions on duties. This ensures fair trade practices.

items.title: Gautam Solar to invest ₹4,000 crore to set up solar cell manufacturing plant in Madhya Pradesh
items.summary: After the successful completion of Phase 1, Gautam Solar plans to launch an IPO to raise funds for Phase 2, which will have an additional 3 GW capacity

items.title: Coal production up 8% over previous month despite monsoons
items.summary: Whilst production increased compared with the previous month, on a financial year-to-date basis until August it marginally declined 0.6%

items.title: Time to make the hard choices needed to conclude trade deal: U.S.-India Business Council
items.summary: The Council representing hundreds of leading American and Indian companies says the two countries have too much at stake in this era of rising geostrategic competition to abandon the progress made together

items.title: Government working on comprehensive package to support exporters hit by U.S. tariffs: Nirmala Sitharaman
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said various industries are sharing the impact with the departments concerned or Ministries as the second part (25%) of the tariff kicked in from August 27, 2025

items.title: India, Qatar likely to finalise terms of reference for FTA in early-October
items.summary: India and Qatar seeks to double their bilateral trade by 2030

items.title: Tamil Nadu second biggest market for small business credit: study
items.summary: As of June 30, 2025, Tamil Nadu had an outstanding small business credit portfolio of about ₹4.21 lakh crore, up 15.7% from ₹3.64 lakh crore as of June 30 2024, the report said.

items.title: Is it possible to mint money from one’s hobbies?
items.summary: Entering the terrains of hobby-investments is a different ball game altogether. Such a foray requires careful understanding, research and patience before it starts yielding gains

items.title: GST reforms will boost consumption, economy: Finance Minister Sitharaman
items.summary: She also emphasises that consumption boost to be provided by the reform and better-than-expected first quarter GDP growth number may help in exceeding the projected pace of 6.3-6.8% for FY26

items.title: India, Israel likely to sign bilateral investment treaty next week
items.summary: India and Israel are strategic partners, and bilateral trade between the countries is close to $4 billion annually

items.title: FPIs withdraw ₹12,257 cr in first week of September on strong dollar, U.S. tariff concerns
items.summary: The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) in equities reached ₹1.43 lakh crore so far in 2025, data with the depositories showed

items.title: Will the GST rate cuts boost the economy? | Explained
items.summary: Which sectors will benefit from the sweeping changes? Which sectors are disgruntled about the change? How long has the rationalisation process been going on? Did the imposition of 50% U.S. tariffs weigh on the decision? What about revenue implications? What lies ahead?

items.title: GST overhaul: Nirmala Sitharaman writes to State Finance Ministers, thanks them
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said States made their view on the proposal to rejig tax rates but ultimately agreed that it was for the benefit of the common man, an argument that helped reach a unanimous decision at the GST Council meeting

items.title: Trump tariff effect: Tamil Nadu’s apparel hubs are unravelling at the seams
items.summary: From August 27, the United States has levied a 50% tariff on Indian goods exported to them, disrupting business for thousands of micro, small and medium-scale enterprises in India in sectors such as textiles, garments, and jewellery. M. Soundariya Preetha reports on how America’s tariffs have upended operations in the apparel hubs of Tiruppur and Karur in Tamil Nadu, a major garment-exporting State

items.title: Fixing problems, unlocking India’s growth potential
items.summary: GST 2.0 is both a tax reform and the start of a new chapter in the growth journey

items.title: Watch: What has changed in GST & what does it mean?
items.summary: The GST Council has slashed rates across essentials, healthcare, agriculture, study materials, and vehicles, moving towards a simpler 2-rate structure.

items.title: Govt. will ensure benefit of GST reductions is passed on to consumers: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: The Union Minister of Commerce and Industry called for a collective effort, and said all sections of the industry had given the assurance that the benefit of substantial reductions would be passed on to consumers

items.title: GST reforms will cause ₹3,700 crore revenue loss to government: SBI report
items.summary: The government estimates the net fiscal impact of GST rates rationalisation will be ₹48,000 crore on an annualised basis

items.title: Swipe now, pay forever | Credit card debt in India is no longer a silent crisis
items.summary: Credit card addiction fuels a silent debt crisis across India

items.title: Imposed tariffs against India for purchasing Russian energy products: Trump administration tells U.S. Supreme Court
items.summary: In a 251-page appeal to the Supreme Court, submitted on Wednesday (September 3, 2025), the Trump administration said that “the President recently authorised IEEPA (International Emergency Economic Powers Act) tariffs against India for purchasing Russian energy products...”
